cinvestav.android.pki.db.controller
Class PersonalKeyController

java.lang.Object
  cinvestav.android.pki.db.controller.PersonalKeyController

public class PersonalKeyController
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements all the methods for accessing the Data Base layer classes, it should be the connection between the view layer an the database layer for retrieve and modify personal keys information

Since:
27/07/2012
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ing. Javier Silva PÃ©rez - [javier]

getById

public PersonalKeyDAO getById(java.lang.Integer personalKeyId)
                       throws DBException
Gets a PersonalKeyDAO object filled with the Data base information using personal Key id as SQL filter

Parameters:
personalKeyId - Key id to be used as filter in the SQL sentence
Returns:
a PersonalKeyDAO object filled with the data base information if the personal key id was found, or an empty PersonalKeyDAO object (personalKey id = 0) if no results were found in the data base
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

Returns:

Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

                                              throws DBException
Gets a list of the personal keys linked to the desired subject id

Parameters:
subjectId - Subject Id that must be search for
Returns:
A List of PersonalKeyDAO filled with the personal keys linked to the asked subject Id in the data base, if no coincidences are found, an empty list will be returned

DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

getAllPrivateKeys

public java.util.List<PersonalKeyDAO> getAllPrivateKeys(java.lang.Integer subjectId)
                                                 throws DBException
Searches all the private keys that belongs to the selected subject, a private key could be a RSA, EC private key or PKCS ones

Parameters:
holderId - Id of the subject of which the keys must be searched
Returns:
a list of PersonalKeyDAO elements
Throws:
DBException

getByAdvancedFilter

public java.util.List<PersonalKeyDAO> getByAdvancedFilter(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> filter)
                                                   throws DBException
Gets a list of personalKeys that were founded using the specified filter

Parameters:
filter - It's a Map which has the following structure:
  • Key = Tag of the filter to be used, should be define in DataBaseDictionary, this tags must be written as a SQL WHERE clause using PreparedStament form for example: 'DBfield = ?' or 'DBfield LIKE ?'
  • Value = Must be a string array of 2 positions where:
    • [0] = Value to be searched in the data base
    • [1] = Data type, according to this, the PreparedStatemen will be constructed, the valid DataTypes are defined in the DataBaseDictionary (e.g DataBaseDictionary.FILTER_TYPE_TABLENAME_FIELDNAME)
Returns:
A list of personalKeys that agrees with the filter
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution
